column2: ALASKA DMV TEST
column4: Alaska

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text

column2: 1. The driver of an emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can legally:
column4: go the wrong way.

column2: 2. A red flashing signal means the same as a:
column4: stop sign.

column2: 3. Alcohol:
column4: increases reaction time.
column6: makes it difficult for drivers to judge their condition.
column8: makes drivers more prone to take chances.

column2: 4. A red traffic sign means?
column4: Stop.

column2: 5. When an emergency vehicle approaches using a siren, lights or other warning devices, you must:
column4: move to the right side of the road and stop until the vehicle has passed.
column6: drive to the nearest intersection and stop.
column8: come to a complete stop as soon as you can see the emergency vehicle in your rearview mirror.
column10: reduce your speed and drive with caution.

column2: 6. What is the meaning of orange traffic signs?
column4: Stop, do not enter or wrong way.
column10: Warning of school, pedestrian, and bicycling activity.

column2: 7. Tailgating:
column4: cannot result in a traffic citation.
column10: can frustrate other drivers and make them angry.

column2: 8. Before turning, you should:
column4: increase your speed.
column6: sound your horn to alert the other drivers.

column2: 9. In case of skidding, drivers should NOT:
column4: tap the gas pedal with their foot.
column6: take their foot off the gas pedal.
column8: steer the car into the direction of the skid.
column10: pump the brakes gently if they are about to hit something.

column2: 10. The amount of space you need to cross traffic depends on the:
column4: road and weather conditions and oncoming traffic.
column10: number of cars in front of you.

column2: 11. This sign means:
column4: No parking between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column6: You can only park between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column8: Parking is not allowed at 8:30 AM and at 5:30 PM

column2: 12. This road sign means:
column4: No right turn
column10: You may turn right after yielding the right-of-way to oncoming traffic

column2: 13. To avoid becoming an aggressive driver, you should:
column4: Adjust your schedule to drive during times with the most highway traffic.
column8: Allow enough travel time to reach your destination on schedule.

column2: 14. What does a flashing red light mean?
column4: Drivers may move forward with caution.
column8: The same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 15. Double solid yellow lines mean:
column4: the lane to the right may pass.
column6: passing is not permitted in either direction.
column8: the lane to the left may pass.
column10: passing is permitted in either direction.

column2: 16. Increasing your vehicle’s speed _____ your field of vision.
column4: decreases

column2: 17. Drivers must not drive at:
column4: a speed that is greater than reasonable.
column6: a speed that is not prudent for the circumstances.
column8: a speed that is greater than the posted speed limit.

column2: 18. Vehicles approaching a school bus with its red lights flashing and its stop sign extended should:
column4: stop only if children are present.
column6: stop and remain stopped until it appears safe to proceed.
column8: slow down and proceed with caution.
column10: stop and remain stopped until the red lights are discontinued and the stop sign is retracted.

column2: 19. You ________ traffic headed toward you when you turn left.
column4: must not yield to

column2: 20. This road sign means:
column4: Side road
